Posts.Content: Oct 12, 2012 08:56AM nwsuburbs wrote: I would also recommend looking to your state's department of health.  I was in a similar situation a few years back and found a program for uninsured and underinsured women for women's health.  In MN it is called Sage Program.  In MN it took a phone call for pre-qualification and I think I had to fill out one form.  Do some research in your state to see if there is something like this as well as the American Cancer Soceity and Breastcancer.org that have already been suggested.
Posts.Title: Scared, trying not to worry mar994 pupmom

Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2012 02:13PM nwsuburbs wrote: Hey meinegirl ~ This may sound weird, but I am happy for you that the waiting is over!  That was the worst for me, I had a PBMX Aug 2nd.  Scared - I am sure you have a wonderful team and just remember that you are a very brave and strong woman!  Sad - it is difficult letting go of a part of your body that you have had for so many years, but just think about it this way - you will have a really nice set of tata's for the rest of your life!  Anxious - you have every right to be!  This is a big surgery and I can tell you from experience that it is not as bad as we allow ourselves to imagine. Stay strong and I will be thinking of you tomorrow!
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2012 02:52PM nwsuburbs wrote: mesha_38,  I feel horrible that you are going through this!  It is scary because some of what you are experiencing, I endured myself.  I am 37 and began having issues 6 yrs ago with strong family history and neg BRCA1/2.  Because of family history, they removed the first lump and I have since gone through many tests and frustrations.  All subsequent cysts have been benign and the three most recent are quite painful.  I have heard the same thing . . . caffine, diet, hormones, etc. even after a complete hysterectomy last fall.  With the current pain, I finally discussed preventative surgeries, I am having my BMX in 4 wks with immediate reconstruction.  I am a little confused.  Your general physician and the radiologist recommend an MRI.  Are you needing a referral to a BC to order the tests?  I would definately do whatever it takes to find the team that will care for you the best.  There is no reason that you should be denied a lumpectomy if the cyst is causing continuous, long-term pain; no matter if insurance is covering it or not!  Your age should have nothing to do with the care you receive.  Cancer can strike at ANY age, not just after 40.  Wishing resolution . . . soon!
Posts.Title: Hi I'm New on this forum and high risk . mesha_38yrs nwsuburbs

Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2012 05:01PM nwsuburbs wrote: You have every right in the world to be nervous.  I had a PBMX with TE on August 2 and I can honestly say that it was not as bad as I imagined.  It actually was easier than my hystorectomy in Nov. 2011!  I am now getting ready for my exchange surgery and am so excited!  Recommended packing . . . button front PJ's to wear when the IV comes out, "smut" magazines to catch up on the latest celeb news, chap stick, hard candy, and have a friend or family member bring you some of your favorite indulgences (frosty from Wendy's or a Subway sandwich, etc.).  Get ready at home with lots of pillows, high protein meals, easy to open snacks, and items you use regularly at counter height.  As many of us are quite independent, don't be afraid to ask for help!  Friends and family want to help and likely don't know how to ask what they can do.  I love the men's shirt idea from Chrisrenee77, and I would add running to your local WalMart for some stretch tank tops (they are on sale!) as they are comfy, you can pin your drains to them, and they are easy to get on and off without going over your head.  Lastly, include any personal care products you use on a daily basis ~ toothbrush, hair brush, face wash, etc. Best of luck tomorrow.  Just remember that the waiting is the worst part, tomorrow your life will change for the better! It is a long road, but you will be surprised how quickly you may feel up to getting out of the house post-op! I will be thinking about you and praying for a quick recovery! {{{HUGS}}}
Posts.Title: BMX + TE scheduled Friday Oct 5th = NERVOUS!!!! JMP287 Chrisrenee77
